dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 2394 RH: National Forest Foundation Reauthorization Act of 2015
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Thompson of Pennsylvania (for himself and Mr. Bost) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture
Additional sponsor: Ms. Michelle Lujan Grisham of New Mexico
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Insert the part printed in italic

form.official-title: To reauthorize the National Forest Foundation Act, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the National Forest Foundation Reauthorization Act of 2015.

subsection.header: Extension of Authority To Provide Matching Funds for Administrative and Project Expenses
subsection.text: Section 405(b) of the National Forest Foundation Act (16 U.S.C. 583j–3(b)) is amended by striking for a period of five years beginning October 1, 1992 and inserting during fiscal years 2016 through 2018.

Section 410(b) of the National Forest Foundation Act (16 U.S.C. 583j–8(b)) is amended by striking during the five-year period and all that follows through $1,000,000 annually and inserting there are authorized to be appropriated $3,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2016 through 2018.

paragraph.text: Section 404(b) of the National Forest Foundation Act (16 U.S.C. 583j–2(b)) is amended by striking under this paragraph and inserting by subsection (a)(4).
Section 407(b) of the National Forest Foundation Act (16 U.S.C. 583j–5(b)) is amended by striking the comma after The Foundation shall.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
